result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon C Koudelka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Balance of bond amount shall be applied.  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen withn 72 hours for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to Waukesha County jail or county jail convenient to employment or residence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to Waukesha County jail or county jail convenient to employment or residence.
Consecutive to: Count 2

Def in person & by Atty Michael G. Levine.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend to Obstructing-946.41(1) and 2 counts of Possession of Controlled Substance-961.41(3g)(b) and states basis.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1, Count 2 and Count 3 as amended.   Court finds def guilty on Count 1, Count 2 and Count 3 as amended and enters judgment.
